response.original_title: Manry at Sea: In the Wake of a Dream
response.overview: In 1965, Robert Manry was a typical middle-aged suburbanite in Cleveland, Ohio. However, his colleagues at the Plain Dealer newspaper were shocked to learn he had just set sail on a solo voyage across the Atlantic in his 13Â½-foot sloop, Tinkerbelle. By the time his 78-day odyssey ended in England, Manry was the target of a wild journalistic arms race, the guest of honor to a welcoming committee of 20,000 Britons, and had become a hero to his countrymen - and to dreamers everywhere.
response.tagline: There is no dream so large that it can't fit into a tiny boat.
response.title: Manry at Sea: In the Wake of a Dream
